edge: Kites is a 2010 Indian romantic action thriller film directed by Anurag Basu.
Anurag Basu, is an Indian film director, producer and screenwriter who directed the film Kites.
Kites was produced by Rakesh Roshan.
Hrithik Roshan is an Indian actor who appeared in the film Kites, portraying the character of Kites.
Barbara Mori is an Argentine actress and model who appeared in the film Kites, portraying the character of Kites.
Kangana Ranaut is an Indian actress who appeared in the film Kites, portraying the character of Tanaya.
Kabir Bedi is an Indian actor who appeared in the film Kites, portraying the character of Tanay's father.
The majority of dialogue in Kites is in English.
The majority of dialogue in Kites is also in Spanish.
Kites was advertised as a Hindi-language film in India.
Gina falls in love with Jay, who is a dance teacher and marries immigrant women for money. This indicates that Gina and Jay have a romantic relationship.
Bob Grover is the powerful Anglo-Indian casino owner and father of Gina. Jay's marriage to Gina connects him to Bob Grover.
Tony is marrying Natasha, who is actually Linda, one of the immigrant women Jay married for money. This shows a connection between Tony and Linda.
Linda is an immigrant woman whom Jay married for money. Their marriage has ended with a divorce, indicating a former relationship between them.
Tony and the police are in pursuit of Linda and Jay as they flee towards Mexico.
Robin helps Linda and Jay by giving them fake passports and IDs, indicating a mutual connection between them.

According to distributor Reliance BIG Entertainment, Kites was on 3000 screens in India and across 30 countries and 500 screens globally.
Kites opened on 208 screens in North America, making it the largest Bollywood release there to that time.
Provogue, which features Hrithik Roshan as its brand ambassador, launched a Kites clothing range.
A photo shoot regarding the campaign was shot in the Maldives, featuring Hrithik Roshan and Bárbara Mori.

edge: The film received an 72% positive rating on the film critics aggregate site Rotten Tomatoes
from 29 reviews
, with the consensus being,
Thoroughly overwrought in true Bollywood fashion,
Received mixed reviews in India.

And repeated glimpses at the toned bodies of both lead stars. It's almost enough to forgive the uniformly bad acting of all supporting cast
Deeply flawed —and too effervescently charming to resist.

node_1: lovers-on-the-lam blast of pure pulp escapism
node_2: traditional hollywood romance in modern dress
edge: Bollywood film draws from various genres including westerns, musicals, film noir and chase thrillers with preposterous stunts that verge on parody but gets away with everything due to the director's visual bravura and passion for the story.
The film opened to a bumper response in India, but reports suggest that its failure can be attributed to it having a lot of English and Spanish dialogue.
Reviewer from The New York Times called the film 'a lovers-on-the-lam blast of pure pulp escapism' that 'caroms from car chase to shootout, from rain dancing to bank robbing with unflagging energy.'

Critic from Film Journal International stated that the film 'enters telenovela territory in a hybrid film that takes the heightened emotions, wild tonal ranges and impeccably crisp technique of modern Hindi cinema and puts all that in the service of a tragic love story straight out of Mexican TV.'

The critic from Los Angeles Times said that the film 'draws from westerns, musicals, film noir [and] chase thrillers with stunts so preposterous they verge on parody – and it gets away with everything because of [director] Basu's visual bravura and unstinting passion and energy.'
Overall, the film was rated as a flop by Box Office India.

Box Office Mojo shows that while the original Kites film was able to become the first ever original Bollywood created film to score in the 'Top Ten' of the overall Hollywood Box office tally on its opening weekend, the Kites: The Remix hybrid version only managed to place 51st on its first weekend.
On its first weekend in the North America, the film opened in 208 theaters and ranked No. 10 in the box office, grossing $958,673.

node_2: first bollywood movie to reach weekend top ten
edge: It was the first Bollywood movie to reach the weekend top ten, though My Name is Khan had a larger first-weekend North American gross, with $1.9 million at 120 theaters, reaching #13.

The film fared very poorly in the United Kingdom and earned £9,110 on 31 screens, with the per-screen average working out to £294.
